hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout in Liquidity-Sensitive Alts
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes with rising aggregate spot volume but stable prices (low realized vol), liquidity-sensitive mid-cap altcoins (e.g., CRV, GRT, BAT) experience pronounced volatility compression. A breakout from a 7-day Bollinger Band squeeze (Bandwidth < 0.1) will have higher directional reliability and follow-through than during other regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Rising liquidity in a neutral price environment suggests accumulation/distribution. For tokens historically sensitive to liquidity changes, this creates a 'spring-loaded' condition. The compression reflects a balance of forces; the breakout is powered by the latent liquidity now entering/leaving the asset with force, offering a clean volatility signal.
entry_conditions: Aggregate spot volume 5D MA is above its 20D MA (liquidity rising)
Target altcoin (CRV/GRT/BAT) 7-day Bollinger Bandwidth (20,2) crosses below 0.1, then closes outside the bands

exit_conditions.take_profit: Close trade when price reaches a 1.5x ATR(14) target in the breakout direction or volatility regime shifts.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close if price reverses and closes back inside the Bollinger Bands.
exit_conditions.time_exit: Exit at market on close of the 5th trading day post-breakout.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Falsified if the win rate for breakouts in the specified direction (long on upper break, short on lower break) under these conditions is not statistically significantly greater than 55% and the average gain is less than 1.0x ATR.
